definition: to bring sth to sb (news etc)
to bring sth to sb/to deliver
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: Fumigating wind brings us another spring, and also makes the ground green.
sentences.chinese: 熏风捎来又一个春天，也熏绿了大地。

sentences.english: With September comes a sense of autumn.
sentences.chinese: 九月悄然给我们捎来了一丝秋意。

sentences.english: See its like the LiuQingGu armor, take to armor to cow flowers.
sentences.chinese: 见其喜欢军装，就把刘青家捎来的军装送给牛鲜花。

sentences.english: I've brought your children some peanuts.
sentences.chinese: 我给你孩子捎来一点花生。

sentences.english: My friend sent word that he was well.
sentences.chinese: 我朋友捎来口信说他很好。

sentences.english: Green buds send the greeting of early spring.
sentences.chinese: 那一抹鲜绿的嫩芽，捎来早春的问候。

definition: to bring sth to sb/to deliver
to take a letter/to send word
to send word/to deliver a letter
to prepare/to arrange (sth to be offered)
to constantly have (sb or sth) on one's mind
on leaving/on the point of departure
to worry about/to be concerned about
to forward (a message, letter, article etc)
to pass on a story/to communicate a message
